Strategy

Coping with complexity

The Strategy Issue of the Journal of Erratic Observations sets out to develop an understanding of strategy that can be used across disciplines.

If you have a vague understanding of what you mean by strategy, your strategies are likely to be as vague. In a collaborative setting, the outcome is doomed to be even less powerful if no contributor bothers to agree on a common understanding.

Articles

001

What is strategy?

Strategy is a dangerous term. Physically dangerous for its roots in military planning: Whenever a strategos of the Hellenistic world devised a strategy to handle affairs with you, you damn well better be prepared for a brute force attack. And conceptually dangerous for its multidisciplinary use without acknowledging its multiple meanings. Don't let too many cooks spoil the broth.

Case Study

Making the European Commission change its mind
